slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचअनाश्रित: कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति य: ।स सन्न्यासी च योगी च न निरग्न‍िर्न चाक्रिय: ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: One who performs his duty without attachment to the results is a true renunciant and a yogi, not one who has merely renounced rituals.

slokas: यं सन्न्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव ।न ह्यसन्न्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: They say that what is known as renunciation is the same as yoga, O Pandava. He who has not given up his sankalpa (desires and attachments), cannot be a yogi.

slokas: आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते ।योगारूढस्यतस्यैव शम: कारणमुच्यते ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: For one who is aspiring to reach the stage of yoga, work is said to be the means. For one who is already established in yoga, serenity is said to be the means.

slokas: यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्ज‍ते ।सर्वसङ्कल्पसन्न्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: When one is not attached to the fruits of one's actions, but all desires are extinguished within the mind, then one is said to have attained to the state of yoga.

slokas: उद्धरेदात्मनात्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् ।आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मन: ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: Lift yourself by yourself, do not let yourself down. For the self is the friend of oneself, and the self is the enemy of oneself.

slokas: बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जित: ।अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत् ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: A man's own self is his friend, a man's own self is his foe.

slokas: जितात्मन: प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहित: ।शीतोष्णसुखदु:खेषु तथा मानापमानयो: ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: For one whose self is conquered, whose mind is serene, and who is absorbed in the Supreme Self, there is happiness and distress, heat and cold, honor and dishonor.

slokas: ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्‍तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रिय: ।युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्ट्राश्मकाञ्चन: ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: The yogi is said to be united when he is satisfied with knowledge and wisdom, has conquered the senses, and remains steadfast.

slokas: सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु ।साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: A person with an equal mind towards friends, companions, enemies, neutrals, the hateful, relatives, the righteous, and the unrighteous, excels.

slokas: योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थित: ।एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रह: ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: The yogi should constantly try to keep the mind absorbed in the Self, remaining alone, with mind and body controlled, free from expectation and possessiveness.

slokas: श‍ुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मन: ।नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम् ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: Establishing oneself in a clean place, with a firm seat, not too high nor too low, covered with sacred grass, a deerskin, and a cloth.

slokas: तत्रैकाग्रं मन: कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रिय ।उपविश्यासने युञ्‍ज्याद्योगमात्मविश‍ुद्धये ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: Having made the mind one-pointed, with the activities of the senses and the mind controlled, one should sit on the seat to practice yoga for the purification of the self.

slokas: समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिर: ।सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन् ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: Keeping the body, head, and neck straight and still, gazing at the tip of the nose without looking in any other direction.

slokas: प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थित: ।मन: संयम्य मच्च‍ित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्पर: ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: With a calm mind, free from fear, established in the vow of celibacy, having controlled the mind and fixed it on Me, he should sit with Me as his supreme goal.

slokas: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानस: ।शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: Thus, always disciplining oneself, the yogi with subdued mind attains the supreme peace of nirvana, abiding in Me.

slokas: नात्यश्न‍तस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्न‍त: ।न चातिस्वप्‍नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: There is no yoga for one who eats too much, nor for one who abstains from eating too much; there is no yoga for one who sleeps too much, nor for one who stays awake too much, O Arjuna.

slokas: युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु ।युक्तस्वप्‍नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दु:खहा ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: Regulated diet and recreation, regulated effort in actions, and regulated sleep and wakefulness lead to the destruction of all suffering.

slokas: यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते ।निस्पृह: सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: When the restrained mind dwells only in the self, free from desire for all objects, then one is said to be in yoga.

slokas: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता ।योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मन: ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: As a lamp in a windless place does not waver, so is the properly restrained mind of the yogi who practices union with the self.

slokas: यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया ।यत्र चैवात्मनात्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: When the mind ceases from its restless wanderings, and is subdued by the practice of yoga, the seer beholds the self within, and finds contentment in the self.

slokas: सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद्‍बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् ।वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वत: ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: That which is perceived by the intellect as the supreme bliss, beyond the reach of the senses, wherein this person does not waver, is established in that truth.

slokas: यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं तत: ।यस्मिन्स्थितो न दु:खेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: Having obtained which, no other gain is thought to be greater than that; in whom established, even by great pain is not disturbed by a teacher.

slokas: तं विद्याद्दु:खसंयोगवियोगं योगसंज्ञितम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: Know that to be Yoga which delivers from contact with pain.

slokas: स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा ।सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषत: ।मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्तत: ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: With determination, discipline the mind to be free from attachment; giving up all desires born of the will, completely restraining the senses through the mind alone.

slokas: शनै: शनैरुपरमेद्‍बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया ।आत्मसंस्थं मन: कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: Gradually, with the intellect restrained by steadfastness, having established the mind in the self, one should not think of anything at all.

slokas: यतो यतो निश्चलति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् ।ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत् ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: "Wherever and whenever the unsteady and restless mind wanders, from there it should be brought back under the control of the self alone."

slokas: प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् ।उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम् ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: A yogi with a tranquil mind attains supreme happiness, becoming free from impurities and realizing the pure essence of Brahman.

slokas: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मष: ।सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्न‍ुते ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: Thus, constantly engaging in the self, the yogi, free from sin, attains supreme happiness through contact with Brahman.

slokas: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि ।ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शन: ॥ २९ ॥
slokas_translated: A person in the divine consciousness, although engaged in seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, eating, moving about, sleeping and breathing, always knows within himself that he actually does nothing at all.

slokas: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति ।तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति ॥ ३० ॥
slokas_translated: He who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me, I am never lost to him, nor is he ever lost to Me.

slokas: सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थित: ।सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते ॥ ३१ ॥
slokas_translated: He who serves Me alone, situated in the essence of all beings, that yogi, who is steadfast in oneness, is found in Me, whatever his mode of conduct may be.

slokas: आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन ।सुखं वा यदि वा दु:खं स योगी परमो मत: ॥ ३२ ॥
slokas_translated: By the equanimity of comparing oneself to others, one sees the same in all beings, O Arjuna. The yogi who is the supreme, in my opinion, is he who experiences happiness or sorrow alike.

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचयोऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्त: साम्येन मधुसूदन ।एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम् ॥ ३३ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: O Madhusudana, this yoga of equanimity which You have explained seems impractical and unsteady to me because of the restlessness of the mind.

slokas: चञ्चलं हि मन: कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम् ।तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम् ॥ ३४ ॥
slokas_translated: The mind is restless, turbulent, strong and unyielding, O Krishna. I consider it as difficult to control as the wind.

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचअसंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् ।अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते ॥ ३५ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: Undoubtedly, O mighty-armed Arjuna, the mind is difficult to control and restless, but it can be subdued by constant practice and by detachment.

slokas: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मति: ।वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्‍तुमुपायत: ॥ ३६ ॥
slokas_translated: Yoga is difficult to attain for one of undisciplined mind. But it is possible for one who is disciplined and strives earnestly.

slokas: अर्जुन उवाचअयति: श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्च‍‍लितमानस: ।अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति ॥ ३७ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: O Krishna, what is the destination of one who has faith but is unable to control the mind and falls from the path of yoga, having not attained perfection in yoga?

slokas: कच्च‍िन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति ।अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मण: पथि ॥ ३८ ॥
slokas_translated: O mighty-armed one, one who is deluded falls away from both paths, like a broken cloud, without any support, perishes.

slokas: एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषत: ।त्वदन्य: संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते ॥ ३९ ॥
slokas_translated: O Krishna, you should dispel this doubt of mine completely. No one other than you can dispel this doubt.

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचपार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते ।न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति ॥ ४० ॥
slokas_translated: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: Son of Pritha, there is no destruction for him, either in this world or the next. Never does a person who does good, my child, ever come to grief.

slokas: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वती: समा: ।श‍ुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते ॥ ४१ ॥
slokas_translated: Having attained the worlds of the righteous and dwelling there for eternal time, the fallen yogi is born in the house of the pure and prosperous.

slokas: अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् ।एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम् ॥ ४२ ॥
slokas_translated: Or he is born in the family of yogis, the wise. Such a birth is indeed very rare in this world.

slokas: तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् ।यतते च ततो भूय: संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन ॥ ४३ ॥
slokas_translated: There, he gains the intelligence of the previous body, and strives more for perfection, O Kurunandana.

slokas: पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि स: ।जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते ॥ ४४ ॥
slokas_translated: By the practice of that alone, even one who is unwilling is involuntarily drawn towards it. Even the seeker of Yoga transcends the power of words.

slokas: प्रयत्‍नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संश‍ुद्धकिल्बिष: ।अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥ ४५ ॥
slokas_translated: The yogi who strives with the utmost effort, is purified of all impurities, and has achieved perfection over many births, reaches the supreme goal.

slokas: तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिक: ।कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन ॥ ४६ ॥
slokas_translated: The yogi is greater than ascetics, greater than the learned, greater than those who perform rituals; therefore, be a yogi, O Arjuna.

slokas: योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्ग‍तेनान्तरात्मना ।श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मत: ॥ ४७ ॥
slokas_translated: "Of all yogis, the one with great faith who always abides in Me, thinks of Me within himself, and worships Me, is considered to be the most deeply united with Me in yoga." (Bhagavad Gita 6.47)
